title: American_Top_40_1971_October_23rd
description:
"The most authoritative survey of the best-sellers from Bangor to Burbank; (and from Saginaw to San Antonio) and the countdown continues."


American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This is a recording of a rebroadcast from internet radio.

In this broadcast:

John Lennon debuts his song "Imagine" on the hot 100 all the way up at number 20, and Isaac Hayes moves his song "Theme From Shaft" from number 50 to number 9!

There is a spoken-word record in the countdown of a poem from a popular poster that appears to be a reproduction of a manuscript dated 1692, which would make it three centuries old, but it isn't. Casey gives the details.

At number 29 is Freddy Hart with his hit "Easy Loving" voted Song-of-the-Year by the Country Music Association.

There is a hit by an artist who once scored points with his girlfriend by making a recording artist out of her little brother.
